articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, JACK JEFFERY and LEE KEATH
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — A fragile truce between Israel and Hamas held for a fifth day Tuesday, as international mediators in Qatar worked to extend it and more hostages were freed from Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas frees 12 more hostages from Gaza as fragile truce with Israel holds

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Rosalynn Carter was memorialized Tuesday as a matriarch who felt more comfortable among the impoverished and vulnerable than world leaders, as a rare gathering of all living U.S. first ladies and multiple presidents, including her 99-year-old husband Jimmy Carter in the front row, mourned her.
articles.title: Rosalynn Carter honored by family, friends, first ladies and presidents -- including husband Jimmy

articles.author: MICHAEL CASEY
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — As authorities in Vermont push forward with their investigation of the weekend shooting of three college students of Palestinian descent, they are weighing whether to treat the violence as a hate crime.
articles.title: Was the Vermont shooting of 3 men of Palestinian descent a hate crime? Under state law it might be

articles.author: CLAIRE RUSH, JANIE HAR and MICHAEL CASEY
articles.description: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — Tossing tent poles, blankets and a duffel bag into a shopping cart and three wagons, Will Taylor spent a summer morning helping friends tear down what had been their home and that of about a dozen others.
articles.title: Cities crack down on homeless encampments. Advocates say that’s not the answer

articles.author: SHEIKH SAALIQ
articles.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — The rescue mission was expected to last only a few days. Instead, it took 17 days to reach 41 construction workers who were trapped when a landslide collapsed a mountain tunnel in northern India earlier this month.
articles.title: Why it took 17 days for rescuers in India to get to 41 workers trapped in a mountain tunnel

articles.author: ANITA SNOW and THOMAS MACHOWICZ
articles.description: WENDEN, Ariz. (AP) — A blanket of bright green alfalfa spreads across western Arizona's McMullen Valley, ringed by rolling mountains and warmed by the hot desert sun. Matthew Hancock's family has used groundwater to grow forage crops here for more than six decades.
articles.title: Tensions are bubbling up at thirsty Arizona alfalfa farms as foreign firms exploit unregulated water

articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Americans for Prosperity, the political arm of the powerful Koch network, formally endorsed Nikki Haley's presidential campaign on Tuesday, promising to commit its nationwide coalition of activists — and virtually unlimited funds — to helping Haley defeat former President Donald Trump in the GOP primary contest.
articles.title: Nikki Haley wins backing from powerful Koch network as she aims to take on Trump

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD
articles.description: VATICAN CITY (AP) — Pope Francis canceled his trip to Dubai for the U.N. climate conference on doctors’ orders Tuesday, even though he is recovering from the flu and lung inflammation, the Vatican said.
articles.title: Pope cancels trip to Dubai for UN climate conference on doctors' orders while recovering from flu

articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Hunter Biden offered Tuesday to testify publicly before Congress, striking a defiant note in response to a subpoena from Republicans and setting up a potential high-stakes face-off even as a separate special counsel probe unfolds and his father, President Joe Biden, campaigns for reelection.
articles.title: Hunter Biden tells Congress he'd testify publicly, setting up a potential high-stakes face-off

articles.author: DAVID McHUGH
articles.description: FRANKFURT, Germany (AP) — German Chancellor Olaf Scholz vowed Tuesday that his government will work “as fast as possible” to solve a budget crisis, but he offered few details on how he would achieve his goals of promoting clean energy and modernizing the struggling economy after a court decision struck down billions in planned spending.
articles.title: The worst-performing major economy also faces a budget crisis. Germany's leader vows fixes, but how?
